revised_title: Circadian Tau Gene Mutation Affects Photoperiodic Response in Syrian Hamsters
tldr: The study investigates the impact of a mutation in the circadian timing system (tau gene) in Syrian hamsters, which alters their reproductive response to changes in photoperiod. The tau mutation accelerates the period of the circadian activity cycle, and the research shows that tau and wild-type hamsters exhibit a differential response to photoperiod change. The tau genotype may have a different critical night-length with respect to both the gonadal and prolactin axes, approximately 1-2 h shorter than wild-type genotypes, supporting the hypothesis that the circadian tau mutation has altered the basis of photoperiodic time measurement.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
